reviews.text: I’m disgusted. My boyfriend went to appeal his ticket, and they didn’t even give him a chance to explain his situation. Isn’t that the point of appealing a ticket ?  Right off the bat that were extremely rude. I’d give them negative stars if I could. And they make parking super difficult. Probably just so they can ticket your car again.
I love the interior of this building. Reminds me of the ghostbusters movie. you can definitely see the old world inside this building. They have this super cool wooden elevator that still works.
Beautiful tower and historical place in town.
Whenever I get asked if this place is cool, I say "city hall yeah!"
Beautiful old building with a lot of important people inside.  Most people won't visit here without a good reason.

Once we got through the traffic, we had to seek out a parking space... That took awhile and then we had to park 2 miles away. We were in  "The Egg" for a convention. Clean and well layed out. At one point we were on the Legislative staircase, then had to check out the "Million-Dollar Staircase" and seek out the little carving of the devils' face. Good for a visit. Glad I don't live there.

We went there in our way to Vermont. It was nice to walk around downtown even though it was cold. I am sure that during summer with warm weather, the view of empire square should be great. It's an old-fashioned square that looks out a movie from the 50's.

Albany is both quaint and international. It's a small city with thousands of visitors coming through every day. The Nelson Rockefeller empire State Plaza is a very spacious structure that is both landmark and modern. It contains the governor's office, the state senate and assembly buildings.

Visited the New York State Capitol as part of a group of citizens to advocate for a cause. It was very beautiful, inside and out. Visited the "Egg." Great way to see democracy in action. A must for families with children!

I went for a Saturday tour on March 16. The tour guide was kiersten. She did a wonderful job and she was very informative. The YMCA conference was going on in the assembly room and it was fun to watch. The building is full of stone carving done by hand and beautiful woodwork. This building is one of a kind and worth the trip. If you go on the tour, be sure to go in the underground tunnel and meet at the gift shop. The underground tunnel looks like a mall, hard to believe it's underground.
This is a must see if you are interested in military history at all. Our tour guide was very friendly and full of knowledge.
The only Destroyer Escort still floating in the continental United States, And the tours are a very informative and fun.

Great family friendly tour of a WWII ship.  Very informative and interesting.  We were able to get some good pictures of our kids on the AA guns and our tour guide was knowledgeable and interactive.  Highly recommend a stop here

My family toured the USS Slater today and we had a great time. We had a tour guide named Will. He did an amazing job explaining the functions of the ship. The tour lasted about an hour. I highly recommend making plan to tour this great piece of history.

Probably the nicest museum ship I've ever visited. Extremely high quality restoration work, very knowledgeable tour guides, and no glass panels blocking off the compartments. For a additional $6 you can get a guided tour of two after engine rooms (be sure to ask the cashier about this). Only disappointment is that you can't roam the ship freely at all; once the tour is over, you have to get off.

I love this place! It’s big enough to keep you interested for hours but not a huge place.  They rotate several of the exhibits regularly which is nice.  Personally, I really enjoy learning about Albany history so those exhibits are really cool to me.  Staff is always super nice.  I’ll definitely be back.  In fact it’s one of the places I bring people who visit me from out of town.
What a variety of beautiful art and artifacts on display! Helpful and informative staff members are willing to explain and answer any questions. Perfect place to spend a quiet "me time" afternoon!

Only one floor was open when I went recently, as exhibitions were being swapped out in the other, but there was still plenty to see (and the admission price was halved due to there being the one less floor) anyhow.

The flow of the place lends itself well to easy meandering, the staff is very friendly and helpful and the exhibits themselves are well-curated.

And at only $10/person for adults, it’d be worth coming a few times a year.
Nice exhibit. The best collection of Hudson Valley artists I have seen.
Always interesting. Friendly staff. While the exhibitions can be small it can be more relaxing that the sometimes daunting exhibits at larger museums. An Albany treasure!

I love everything about the pine bush. The lupine in the summer, the quiet trails to walk, the super cool conservation station and I attend lots of registered events like bird counting and am always fascinated by the educational seminars. My favorite one was learning about turtles!

Nice nature preserve with some hiking trails and a few biking trails. The trails are very Sandy so they dry out quickly. It's a great place to go in the early spring to avoid mud. Watch out for the ticks, they have more than their fair share.

Beautiful preserve with lots of hiking trails. It’s beautiful and unique in every season.  Clam and peaceful with lots of photo opportunities.  They have a photo contest in Sept/Oct where you can submit your best shots from the preserves for prize and the exhibition so save your best clicks for that.  The staff is very friendly and always welcome you with a smile.

I love the Pine Bush.  It's beautiful in all seasons, the trails are well maintained, and the chance of seeing an endangered specie is actually pretty good.  And it's all free, even the museum, which is good for a few hours to entertain a kid.  They're also always having events and sponsoring things, which turns out to be a great reason to be outdoors for a while.
Beautiful place to hike. Maps available digitally and physically, as well as a bird checklist for bird watchers. Definitely planning on a trip back with more time to spare.

Amazing concert venue. I have been going to this venue for years and I'm always amazed by the ornate detail of this theater. Great space and easy to get in and out of. Great places to grab something to eat and drink nearby as well. Weather it be comedy shows, music or plays, the Palace is a great spot to enjoy.

Beautiful building in downtown Albany. Saw Justin Moore last night.. Pretty clean. Sticky floors but that's what happens when drinks spill. Would definitely go to another show there. I didn't think any seat in the house was a bad seat. We had 10th row. But I also went to back for a breather and those seats weren't bad either.

This theatre is absolutely gorgeous and sounds great. The staff is awesome and concession costs are reasonable with a decent selection of canned craft brews available for $8. I highly recommend seeing any show here.

Attended a concert here with my daughter. Small venue made it seem very personal. I don't believe there was a bad seat in the house! The baroque style 
interior was beautiful. Depending on the band, I would definitely make the four hour drive to return to the Palace Theatre.

I really enjoyed seeing my favorite band at this venue. The architecture in this place is beautiful. The sound is great. The staff was kind.  Seating for the event was first come first sat. I will definitely return for a show in the future.\mm/
this space is second to none. food is ok depending on what you get. and beer is good.

I steady and reliable place with enjoyable food and a nice variety of craft beers.  This is the type of place you go and are always satisfied with the food, atmosphere, and service.  You get what you pay for, so don't come here looking for a cheap meal, but if you're new to the area, you should definitely give Albany Pump Station a try.

Food was good. Beer was meh. The brown ale was good other than that forgettable. It’s the service that was bad. As in horrible. We saw our waiter 3 times and all the other staff members were clearly covering for a not great employee. Will not return and would not recommend.
Went and Had a flight Tasting and dinner last night the food was amazing, beer just as delicious.  A hidden gem in the city!
Great place for beer and food. Incredible staff.

Fun! Great food! Terrific staff! All ages. Families. Dates. Groups if couples night out. Friends at bar... regardless everyone is smiling and happy. Makes it an extra great place to relax and enjoy that positive customer excitement. Very reasonably priced. This is my go to neighborhood go to spit! Thank you, El Loco.
Hands down one of my top 5 favorite Mexican cafes in the area. Super authentic mexican cuisine. I loved the atmosphere, the food, the wait staff. All of it. A really really really good place to dine.
Great food. Interesting varied menu. Great salsa and generous portions. Happy hour specials. Weird tamales though.

Best Mexican I've had in Albany, this is not your typical taco truck by far. Everything about this small place is perfect, right between Lark St. and Washington Park, with other great shops nearby, it's great to eat and browse the boutiques. Or, satisfy some cravings and wander the park for a while. Inside is warm and inviting and you feel personally taken care of. Fantastic!

I ordered a lunch special of a mushroom quesadilla during a quiet afternoon. The food was delicious and plentiful. I enjoyed the surroundings. Service was friendly and responsive. Price was reasonable.

An excellent restaurant in downtown Albany. They have an extensive menu with choices to please any taste including vegetarians. Service is always attentive and fast. If it's a nice day, opt for the outdoor seating. And if there's a wait for a table, wander over to Capitol Park to check out the Capitol building, the reflecting pool and of course The Egg!

Not what I would call authentic Mexican food, but very good nonetheless. On street parking which can be limited and if you want to eat outside (which I totally recommend) then you should make a reservation. The place is always clean and my experience with the staff has been great. Delicious food and drinks, nice dining atmosphere and good prices. This is a great place to eat with family and friends.

Had my first experience at this establishment and it was pretty good.  It is a very small place but the quality of food was good.  It's located right behind the plaza and parking is a bit limited but otherwise it's worth a try.  They do accept reservations which I recommend making since it quickly because packed while we ate dinner.

Simply put the best Mexican and Spanish food in the capital region. The atmosphere is cozy and intimate and the service is great as well. The Frozen margaritas are fantastic and perfectly blended. Very Dope indeed.

Huge and Very Good Authentic Mexican food in downtown Albany. The drinks were very good. The food portions are huge and Very well priced. The decor was Alright it was full the night we went and it felt like we were sitting in the basement

An excellent restaurant in downtown Albany. They have an extensive menu with choices to please any taste including vegetarians. Service is always attentive and fast. If it's a nice day, opt for the outdoor seating. And if there's a wait for a table, wander over to Capitol Park to check out the Capitol building, the reflecting pool and of course The Egg!

Not what I would call authentic Mexican food, but very good nonetheless. On street parking which can be limited and if you want to eat outside (which I totally recommend) then you should make a reservation. The place is always clean and my experience with the staff has been great. Delicious food and drinks, nice dining atmosphere and good prices. This is a great place to eat with family and friends.

Had my first experience at this establishment and it was pretty good.  It is a very small place but the quality of food was good.  It's located right behind the plaza and parking is a bit limited but otherwise it's worth a try.  They do accept reservations which I recommend making since it quickly because packed while we ate dinner.

Simply put the best Mexican and Spanish food in the capital region. The atmosphere is cozy and intimate and the service is great as well. The Frozen margaritas are fantastic and perfectly blended. Very Dope indeed.

Huge and Very Good Authentic Mexican food in downtown Albany. The drinks were very good. The food portions are huge and Very well priced. The decor was Alright it was full the night we went and it felt like we were sitting in the basement
Seriously good old school dining. Wait staff immaculately turned out. Great food. Nice wine list. Very happy!
Service was exceptional! I had the stuffed lobster which was just ok, mashed potatoes and vegetables were very good. My husband said his steak was delicious. Can’t beat the ambiance at Jacks!
Incredible place to get lunch. Reasonable prices for outstanding food. I strongly recommend the crab cakes.
Service was amazing! Food was amazing! the best crab cakes ever!!! jack’s Banana foster Is to die for, Definitely will be returning!!

Food was really good.  We had a reservation and we were seated immediately apon arrival, it was very busy and there was a small snafu as to which waiter was working our table, but the waiter captain sorted it out after I made an inquiry.  The service for the rest of our visit was very good.  Overall we had a nice dinner.  Jack's loses one star for making us wait a little too long for a waiter.  I will be back to jack's next time I'm in albany.

We came here for restaurant week. The food was really good, although we were served slightly different food than was what on the menu (we got brussel sprouts instead of zucchini, for example). The service was incredibly slow, but also for no apparent reason. They weren't super busy or anything. Overall, I'd still come back. The food was all delicious and our server was friendly

Go to Savoy Taproom for good times at great establishment. You can really tell you're at local place that stands out from generic bars and restaurants. What brings me back is well executed food, drinks that vary from a good pint of brew to unique cocktails, and local original music.

LOVE THIS PLACE!! Mostly on the first Sundays of the month when they have a mimosa bar. The mimosas are great, the prices are not too bad to be honest, and their breakfast items are BOMB! I recommend the Farmers breakfast.
We had a great brunch! The mimosa bar was fun and my French toast was great. Prices were reasonable. Everyone had great meals. We will definitely be back!

Really busy on weekends making it hard to get seating and a drink at/around the bar in such a small place.. come early and/or plan ahead. Great cozy vibe and excellent spirits and cocktail menu that changes seasonally. Your drink will be made well and presented in a beautiful fashion!

Larry is just awesome.

I was buying a car and wanted to check the condition.
He was really good and I thank him.
I suggest to reach out to Larry if you wanna save money.

Needed a O2 sensor changed, larry did it quickly and inexpensive, also a year prior needed a mount welded did that quickly and inexpensive, These guys are GREAT, and to the point! It's tough to find honest mechanics anywhere without be overcharged!
Quality work, fair prices, no bs
Larry and his guys are amazing. Very honest and trustworthy mechanic at a great price. Props to Jake and his other members they do a great job as well.
Excellent fast inexpensive service professional understanding extremely honest I only trust lombardos

We needed outside dining, they only had one empty table and told us we could use it until 7:30 for a quick beer and fries. At 7:31 a motorcycle pulls up. He in his bike leathers and full regalia. Sitting on the back dressed for a very formal date, gorgeous ankle length dress, silver motorcycle helmet was a young woman. They politely waited a few moments while we quickly. Moved our party to a recently emptied table. The waitress was great and a memorable evening by all.

AVOID THIS PLACE!!!!!
Went here with my wife and I was sorry that I did. Not one thing they served us was good in my opinion. We were unhappy with the quality of the food(some of it tasted rotten) and it was cold. 
I will not be going back to this place!

Admittedly, we only stopped in for one beer and didn't eat anything but enjoyed the atmosphere so much we stayed for a second. 

This is a great place and if we lived in Albany we would frequent this place. The barman was friendly and the patrons were happy to get to know us. It was truly a place where everyone knows your name.

I was here a few months ago, and Logan was great on the phone while making reservations, very personable and polite. Unfortunately I cannot recall the waiters name, but it was some of the the most exceptional service I have ever recieved in downtown Albany. 
The menu was impressive, and so delicious that complements were sent to the chef. I love how the dining area is between the kitchen where all of the beautiful smells and sounds came from, and the full length windows facing Lark st, which always has a great view, no matter the time of year. 
The service and staff were so amazing I look forward to bringing friends here every chance I get since its so close to my neighborhood.  
I will see you soon!

We live in the neighborhood and my husband and I have walked past this place several times, tonight to our chagrin we decided to give it a try. 
Before I give the reasons our dinner was ruined let me give you the positives. Our server was friendly, the appetizer was edible and the two drinks we had were decent. 
Now moving on....
First off my husband is a very picky eater, I am not. Nonetheless neither one of us could stomach the entree that was served. 

List of issues;

1) The mashed potatoes had turned. 
I almost spit it out, it was so sour and clearly spoiled. 

2) Food was lukewarm. 
This should have been the first clue. They tried to mask the fact it was cold by providing us with hot plates on the side. Oh the irony. 

2)Over seasoned asparagus. 
So I soldiered on to the next part of the meal which were the asparagus, disappointed again. It was way TOO SALTY!!! 

3) Chicken was ok but...
They had some kind of chipotle chocolate glaze on top. It would have been alright had it not been drowned in the sauce. The poor frozen cutlet never had a chance. 

When we brought it to our server's attention she took our plates full of food and said she'd check with the cook only to come back to offer us a $4 piece of cake or $12 drink in replace of a nearly $30 entree. 
So in a nutshell we only had one appetizer and two drinks and paid nearly $70.00+ tip for a horrible meal. To top it all off we still have to pay for dinner at the next place because we're still hungry.
You've been warned!!!
Delicious gyros prepared well. The seating is a bit limited, but the food is great. The best gyros we've had in the Capital Region so far.
Incomparable service. Amazing food! Try the fries-they were cooked perfectly. A few tables for dining in and free coffee with your meal. I really can’t say enough about how friendly the staff is!

Delicious, inexpensive Greek fare. We particularly love their gyros! Only a few tables, so you may want to opt for takeout if you come during their busier times. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. I highly recommend it!

Gyros are alright. Decent service. I just think the food lacks imagination and unique flavor. There's nothing really special about the dishes. I think the portions are also sorta weak for the prices. In short it could be better if the food wasn't made so lazily.
Always reliable.  Great Greek salad with solid ingredients.  Tasty wraps, too!

This has become one of my favorite spots after just two visits. I went for dinner the first time and fell in love with the grit tots and biscuits with honey butter. Amazing start to my meal and the shrimp and grits entree was also incredible. My fiancé had steak which was also very well prepared and juicy. Second time we had brunch and it was amazing! The chicken and waffles were a generous portion with a delicious hot sauce. The French toast had great texture and flavor. I would highly recommend the biscuits and grit tots, must try if you dine here.

This place is assume and the food is great. A nice spin on the hot sauce. I had the shrimp and grits nice size shrimps and grits soft and the seasoning great. I'm from Charleston SC, so I know what good food taste like. 
I could go on and on but you gotta go there and see for yourself.

Have had brunch here twice, both times were excellent. After a night of partying, its hard to beat chicken n waffles with a mimosa. The biscuits are always warm out of the oven, and the gravy was pretty good. The chicken & waffles is a great deal for under $20, its a ton of food that will set you on a path to Deep Couch City. I am salivating just thinking about it.

All of the food was fresh, creative, flavorful and delicious.  The cocktails we're excellent as well.  It has a rustic farmhouse vibe which compliments the southern themed menu.  The atmosphere was lively and energetic and the bar has a unique design with a decent amount of seating.

Go for a good brunch experience. Great food and soothing ambience. 
Must try— Short rib hash and biscuits.

Best Italian food in Albany. I went here for my birthday and had a great time. The atmosphere, food and dining experience make you feel like you are at a high end restaurant in New York city. The wait staff are amazing and really take care of you. The place is always full. You will leave satisfied.

It's where I will have my last meal if given the choice. Every single dish is amazing, from the salad to dessert. The crab and lobster ravioli is my favorite and last meal of choice. Perfect! The family that runs the place is wonderful and accommodating. The downsides are that the place is small and always crowded. And because of this, I don't get there as much as I would like. One small sore spot is the younger waiter, he is forgetful and inattentive. Everyone else is amazing and goes above and beyond! Best meal to be had in Albany!

The service & staff are very polite & helpful.. The mussel's are awesome the sauce they cook them is so good I use the bread they give you to sop up the sauce it's that GOOD!! The chicken antica is my favorite I get it every time & I crave it on my way up there. I also recommend the veal parmigiana. Absolutely freshest ingredients. Friend said his Chilean sea bass was cooked perfectly. Friendliest and professional service. Be sure to make reservations well ahead for a Friday or Saturday.

We were there for the first time and would go back once a week. First greeted by the mater
De' at the door, he took our coats hung them,
Took us to our seats put our napkins on our laps. Very gracious. Food out of this would. 
Salad crisp, entry Delos, wine smooth, dessert the tops. Can't say anything better 
About the place.
Customer service is the best ive seen in the capital region for a restaurant. Food was was phenomenal. We will be going back for sure.

I love Cafe Madison! They have a section on their menu of just vegan/vegetarian meals which is amazing and so delicious. The wait is very long sometimes but it's worth the wait. Plan ahead and you'll love your experience. They alcoholic coffee drinks are also amazing!

food was great. service excellent
 half hour wait but we were informed from app. Which I recommend. overall experience was great
Love, love, love this place. I moved away a few years ago and every time I come back to visit family a trip here is included. The food, the ambiance and service is top notch!

Fantastic breakfast for a group of 6 with very diverse tastes. We ended up ordering the gamut from traditional eggs and bacon, to crab cakes benedict, crepes, and oatmeal pancakes. Everything was hot and delicious, and the servers were attentive but not annoying. Plenty of coffee and a cute space. They also listed some amazing looking breakfast cocktails, but I was driving 3 hours so could not indulge.
Great breakfast spot to go and relax. Great pancakes, and everything on the menu is delicious. Staff is super friendly. Gets packed so reserve your spot on Yelp!
Delicious, quick and easy. I like the beef pho with fish sauce and extra sriracha. Yummm!
The soup here was really good. Service was friendly and helpful.
Not as good as in Toronto, Canada. Price and quality wise.
Good food friendly staff
Great make your own pho and Vietnamese style salads. Good food fast.  Notice the concourse location is only open weekdays 10:30 -- 2:30.
Big bang burrito is where it's at! That thing is packed with straight goodness. Their guac and chips are also very good. The quac has a nice thick consistency to it and the chips come out warm.
This place never disappoints. I had a cheeseburger club wrap that was amazing. I would also highly recommend the breakfast wrap.
Good food but a little overpriced for mostly pre-fab grilled food. My favorite thing to order is the buffalo chicken garden salad. Orders are always made quickly and come out hot.
The Original  Philly Cheesesteak is pretty good. This is a good spot to grab something quick to eat.
Just plain awesome 👍. Great sandwich and service. Worth a revisit... And another, and another
I really liked the food here. If your going as a couple I recommend getting a full pitcher margergerita. It was pretty busy but our server was good. Very colorful atmosphere.

The atmosphere of this place is great—fun and lively. Service attentive. I didn’t get much to eat, but what I did get was fantastic! I ordered the Mexican Tortilla Soup, my judge of a good Mexican restaurant. It was probably the best I’ve had. It was full of flavor with just enough spice. I will definitely order it again. My friends both got tacos and said they were great. Prices are reasonable and in line with other local Mexican restaurants.

The waitstaff was great. Efficient and respectful, meaning we we're allowed time to go over the large menu. Food and drinks arrived timely, hot and cold appropriately! Food was great and pIentaful, although my friend ate all his lol. I asked for a take home bag and they refreshed my guacamole and sour cream. Would definitely go back!

Food was great but i wanted plantains and they told me they don't sell them anymore. I was shocked. A Mexican restaurant with no plantains and that's what I went there for. Service was good people friendly. I would have given a 5

Don't listen to the negative posts saying its not authentic. The owner is from far south of the border and some of the staff. My wife is Mexican from near the border in San Diego and states that this is the best in the area and we do all the Mexican spots. Best Chimichangas I've had. Don't mind the ppl who just look to complain and go there now!

The best chicken salad I have had anywhere, including my own home made. It just dosent compare. Their fresh tomato mozzarella is wonderful too.  Generous portions, amazingly kind staff good prices. If you live or work nearby I highly recommend giving this place a try.
don't get over here as much as I'd like to because it's on the opposite end of town and I HATE driving through Albany. But this place never disappoints.

We have traded at Ragonese for about 30years. The owners and staff have grown and matured over time and the business has also. Polite ,Caring, Attentive and always personable to everyone who comes into the business. They have a full menu of cooked and cold food. Boars Head cold cuts and delicates. Yummy.

Deliciously wonderful Italian cuisine! 
My go to for lunch when I want a sandwich and food made with love! 
Excellent products!
Great spot for what you need. Lunch, dinner to Go, and of course cannolis. Love this place
Best old school red sauce Italian restaurant around. Absolutely delicious food, and welcoming hosts and servers. We do their two for $25 deal probably once a week. Wonderful people, place, and food.

Great mom and pop that I have been meaning to try for the first time and it won't be the last. Great service, timing of appetizers, salad and entries was perfect. They even welcomed us to come in right away on a Saturday night when calling ahead. This is a small place so reservations are recommended. Don't miss this gem.

This was the 1st time I have been here. The food was very good. I had the chicken cacciatore which was very good. The menu had a good variety of different Italian dishes. The atmosphere was inside was very nice as well. It was almost like you were visiting someone at their house to have dinner. The service was very good as well. Always coming back to the table to make sure you have everything you need.

The taste, smell and ambiance of the Italian restaurants you used to go to when there was a good italian restaurant in every neighborhood.  Had the chicken Dolce. Excellent!  Bread was fresh/tasty. Others were very happy with their meals. Did not get a chance to try dessert; most of which are home made from what was said.  EST! EST! EST!
Love this place.  Italian dishes that can't be beat and always helpful and timely service.

I stay at the hotel connected to this restaurant often for work.  I always eat breakfast here, and sometimes dinner.  I’ve always enjoyed the food, but the morning hours do have slow service. Evening service has always been efficient.
Everyone is super friendly here as well.

I was quite surprised to find this fantastic restaurant attached my to hotel.  Hotel restaurants are usually a miss.  This spot is not.  Excellent scratch made food.  Kind and conversational staff.  A small, but good selection of beer, whiskey and other spirits.  The menu is limited, but I ate here three times in a week and found something good each night as they rotate the menu.  I wouldn’t even have to be staying at the hotel to come back here if I was local.  I’d even bring a date here if I was.
Good food.  Chef does use local ingredients and also every layer of food is seasoned well.  Small cozy but not very formal setting.
Food was was bland. Definitely not great especially when compared to other restaurants in the area. Service was good. Drinks were fine
Had a wonderful time and good food. Waitstaff were very helpful and friendly.

The sushi is outstanding. A great variety on the menu, the hibachi experience is good if not unique. But the sushi is the real star here, consistently fresh and top quality. Well worth the higher than average prices you'll pay. Cozy place, but still plenty of room even for fairly large parties. If you're sitting at a hibachi, it can hold 10 well.

The hibachi dinners were fun to watch being prepared.  The food was good and a nice atmosphere to celebrate a birthday dinner.  The cost was on the high side for me.  But it was a special occasion.  I'd recommend Koto for dinner.  It's easy to access the restaurant and plenty of parking.

Long wait. Rude staff. Would never come here again. Hana is way better. Koto sucks.

Update. The food sucks. This is the trailer park of Japanese restaurants. If you do have the unfortunate opportunity to come here and do not have to drive, I would suggest having a few drinks while you are there to numb the horrible Koto experience.

The sprite tastes like dirt.

I regret coming here.....
This place was excellent! The showmanship of the cook was on point and the food was  delicious. We all had a great time.
Always a great time... They always make it a great time.. I tip hibachi in the beginning and we ALWAYS have a WONDERFUL time!!!
Service was very good.  The blue berry pancakes we're tasty.  The Texas eggs were a nice change.  However the coffee was so-so.
This is one of my favorite places for lunch in the area. Clean and naturally, good food. Recently I brought my dad here before his appointment at Albany Med. Perfect!

Listen man, this is the spot. I FREAKIN' love the breakfasts here! The banana bread french toast, the fresh orange juice,  the Belgain waffle with the bacon in it and eggs on top?! Coffee is always fresh! Plus, Stuyvesant plaza is just pleasant to visit.
A very comfortable place with great service and good food that has a homemade touch. It’s a great place to take hungry college students for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Strong recommend.
Great selection of breakfast foods. I went with the California Omelette with roasted red pepper and avocados. Very tasty. I recommend.

Visiting Albany for a week. Found this unique place near the Hampton Inn. Lots of coffee choices and food options. Went here several times and everything was really good. Casual and quirky couldn't help but smile. Staff very friendly and helpful.
What a cute Coffee House! Tons of choices for Beverages ... Tons of beautifully baked pastries. You can get breakfast or lunch items also. Great service. Looking forward to next visit:)

Went here for the first time yesterday. What a cute place! Plenty of seating and excellent service. Very comfortable and friendly setting. Cranberry scone and coffee were amazing! Definitely going back for lunch!

I have been going to this cafe, over the years, I like coming here. It's a cute atmosphere to hang out for few hours. I like their food and unique drinks.Workers seem very caring, and like to somewhat to get to know you. Like a little family like gathering.
Cute place,  great drinks,  nice food.  Loved the paninis. Typical coffee shop,  but we really loved the atmosphere! The service was awesome. Thank you!

Up until today my orders have been great. However, tonight I was very disappointed when making an order. I order at least once a week from work and have encouraged co-workers to also order from here. To my disappointment, when we ordered tonight they denied us the coupon for spending over $35. because we ordered a combo,( which is pretty much as ordering reg sushi rolls), when in fact we were spending over $40. We then changed our order, then it went up to over $50 and all we got was the free roll that was for the orders over $35 instead of offering us what we should've received. I'm good to be honest, I just wish this restaurant would recognize to give a little when ppl spend a lot. The icing on the cake for me was/is when ordering I need to tell them that each item is separate, when this should kind of be assumed when making a large order. It was crazy uncomfortable to not only not have plates but to have to share containers. 

Tonight will be the last time I spend one dime at this establishment.

Extremely long wait for at least 6 people working. Food was decent. Prices were good. We went here because Yelp said it was the best in Albany, if ever in the area again we would try another establishment.

Very authentic Japanese cuisine with a wide sushi menu. Comfortable atmosphere with a striking sushi bar. The restaurant includes a traditional Japanese dining room for a large group. Want excellent sushi? Eat at Sushi Tei.

Came here for Valentines day and I was pleasantly surprised. Sushi was some of the best I've had in the area. Miso soup and salad were packed w/ flavor. Cocktails were a little small, but packed a punch and were carefully put together and soo flavorful. Prices are very fair. Entree's were perfectly cooked and delicious. Service was great. They are doing an awesome job here!! My one suggestion is, they should work on a new sign for the location. The sign doesn't speak well for the absolute fabulous place this is. Plus a new sign may stand out more, catching more traffic from Western Avenue. Will absolutely be back :)

I love this place. They are great for an intimate dinner for 2 or a large party, just make sure you book in advance for parties larger than 5 (obviously). Great sushi rolls, great ramen, the only place I know of around that has takoyaki, and they have a full bar with a great cocktail menu.
